articles.title: First images of Mercury captured by joint European and Japanese spacecraft - Sky News

articles.title: EU army backfires: Europeans set to revolt against Macron and Brussels' latest power-grab - Daily Express
articles.description: EMMANUEL MACRON'S recent push for an EU army and a bloc-wide foreign policy has backfired, as voters across the bloc 'do not want people in Brussels making those decisions'.

articles.title: Europe-Japan space mission captures images of Mercury - The Straits Times
articles.description: It has been a three-year wait for the black and white images sent by the BepiColombo spacecraft.. Read more at straitstimes.com.
articles.content:
PARIS (AFP) - The European-Japanese BepiColombo spacecraft has sent back its first images of Mercury, the nearest planet to the Sun, the European Space Agency said on Saturday (Oct 2).

articles.description: It's the first of six Mercury flybys before BepiColombo enters orbit in 2025.
